bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Peter Doyle, 20 December [1876]
bibl.orgName: The Trent Collection of Whitmaniana, Duke University Rare Book, Manuscript, and Special Collections Library

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: Letter rec'd—(& very glad every way—& thanks)—I think I am really better this winter—The cold & snow & ice keep me in the house—else I should have been over to the W Phil[adelphia] depot—it would have done me good, even to have a minute, & a good hold of you once more—Nothing new in my affairs—I am doing well enough—Tell Mr & Mrs NNash I want to come to WashWashington once more, & I have not forgot the pictures—
